definition: to dash/to move forward quickly/to bulge/to protrude/to break through/to rush out/sudden/Taiwan pr. [tu2]
to attack/to inherit/classifier for suits (esp. of funeral robes)

sentences.english: They are solitary stalkers, ambushing prey from a hiding place.

sentences.english: Min hopes to find the source of funds Zhao Xiangze plan to raid.

sentences.english: Only Mr. Li was home when they swooped in on Feb. 3.

sentences.english: Officials have said no one fired on the US navy Seals in Bin Laden's house.
sentences.chinese: 官方却说海豹突袭队抵达拉登住宅时没有人东火。

sentences.english: Five months after his appointment a huge earthquake struck, leading to Haiti's worst medical emergency.

definition: to mount a sneak attack/to raid
to besiege/to beleaguer/to attack from all sides/to jointly speak or write against sb
to stop/to obstruct/to bar the way
dominant/controlling/strong/opposite: weak, yielding 弱受/to take by storm (military)
sudden and violent attack/assault/fig. rushed job/concentrated effort to finish a job quickly
